Cytherissa lacustris, a species of creature called ostracods, only grow to about a millimetre in length. Until now, it was thought that the animal was found exclusively in oceans around New Zealand, and that researchers haven’t ever detected them on land.

However, a team of researchers from the University of Otago in New Zealand have recently found that not only do these little crustaceans exist on land, but they are far more widespread than had previously been thought. The researchers discovered ostracods in Australia, and it is suspected that they also live in India, the Middle East, Korea and perhaps even Siberia.
